alert.note: Alert for Cook (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 12 at 2:28AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Minnesota, including the following county, Cook. * WHEN...Until 400 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 227 AM CDT Friday, gauge reports indicated elevated stream flows due to snow melt. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, Cascade River State Park, Grand Marais, Judge C.R. Magney State Park, and Grand Portage. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Keep children and pets close and under control. Strong river currents can sweep children away. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Hikers should avoid flooded trail crossings.
